channel.title: Cheese on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Cheese on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Mac and Goat
item.description: Mac and Goat calls for goat cheese; we generally use a goat gouda or a goat cheddar, both of which are usually available at the local Trader Joe’s. Feel free to substitute any hard cheese that melts well in your recipe. The dish also calls for rice pasta, but again feel free to substitute; you’re aiming for something like a rotini which handles the sauce well. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.

item.title: recipe: tortilla casserole
item.description: This comes out kind of like a lasagna and is designed the same way: lots of layers. Ingredients: one package tortillas (whole wheat, corn, or flour) one can tomatoes with chiles one can black beans 1/2 jar corn relish one package shredded cheese assemble in layers, roughly as so: tortillas tomatoes with chiles tortillas beans cheese tortillas relish cheese Bake in a 350 degree oven; I left it in for about an hour, until the top was nicely browned and not singed.
